title: Sony Xperia
content:
{{Improve|date=September 2022|reason=Article is short, doesn't contain much information, and sometimes goes off topic.}}{{Distinguish|text =[[Xperi]]}} {{short description|Brand of smartphones from Sony}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2020}} {{Infobox information appliance | name = Sony Xperia | logo = Xperia Logo.svg | logo_size = 200px | image = Sony Xperia 1 III.png | image_size = 200px | caption = The front face of [[Sony Xperia 1 III|Xperia 1 III]] | manufacturer = [[Sony Ericsson Mobile Communications]] (2008–2012)
[[Sony Mobile Communications]] (2012–2021)
[[Sony Corporation]] (2021–present) | type = [[Smartphone]], [[tablet computer|tablet]], [[phablet]] | os = [[Android (operating system)|Android]] {{small|(since 2010)}}
[[Windows Mobile]] {{small|(2008–2010)}} | soc = {{Plainlist| *[[Qualcomm Snapdragon|Snapdragon]] * [[MediaTek]] * Others {{small|([[NovaThor]] and [[Tegra]])}} }} | input = [[Touch screen]] | releasedate = {{start date and age|2008|10|27|df=y}} }} '''Xperia''' ({{IPAc-en|ɛ|k|ˈ|s|p|ɪər|i|ə}}) is the brand name of [[smartphone]]s and [[tablet computer|tablet]]s from [[Sony]]. The name Xperia is derived from the word "experience", and was first used in the [[Sony Ericsson Xperia X1|Xperia X1]] tagline of "I Xperia the best". [[Sony Mobile]] was previously known globally as Sony Ericsson before being rebranded in 2012 as a result of the mobile phone manufacturer being taken over and solely owned by Sony.{{cite web|url=http://www.androidcentral.com/sony-ericsson-officially-sony-mobile-communications-rebranding-occur-within-month|title=Sony Ericsson now owned solely by Sony; rebranding to occur within the month|publisher=Androidcentral.com|access-date=16 February 2012|date=16 February 2012}} ==History== [[File:Sony Ericsson Xperia X1 on sale 20081229.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Windows-powered Xperia X1, the very first Xperia device]] The Xperia X1 was the first phone to be released in the Xperia range.{{cite news|last1=Wilson|first1=Mark|title=XPERIA X1 Hiptop Killer: Sony Ericsson's First Video Plus Gallery|url=https://gizmodo.com/354742/xperia-x1-hiptop-killer-sony-ericssons-first-video-plus-gallery|access-date=21 October 2015|publisher=Gizmodo|date=2 October 2008}} Released in 2008, it featured a high resolution display (~311 ppi pixel density) and it was intended to fill the widening gap of smartphones as other competitors were producing high-end smartphone devices such as [[HTC]] and [[Apple Inc.|Apple]]. The X2 was released in the following year, which included an 8.1 MP camera and included Wifi and GPS. By this time there was a clear shift towards the smartphone end of the spectrum. An exception was the [[Sony Ericsson Xperia Pureness|Xperia Pureness]], a translucent phone without camera that was sold by selected retailers in selected cities.{{cite news|title=First Click: The clear appeal of transparent gadgets|url=https://www.theverge.com/2015/5/12/8590501/the-clear-appeal-of-transparent-gadgets|access-date=21 October 2015|publisher=The Verge|date=12 May 2015}}[http://www.sonyinsider.com/2010/11/30/the-xperia-x12-completely-detailed-by-mobile-review/ Sony Ericsson XPERIA X12 Completely Detailed By Mobile Review] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120620163717/http://www.sonyinsider.com/2010/11/30/the-xperia-x12-completely-detailed-by-mobile-review/ |date=20 June 2012 }}. Sony Insider (30 November 2010). Retrieved 18 October 2011. The Xperia X5 Pureness is based on Sony Ericsson's proprietary operating system (OSE). The X10 was released at the start of 2010.{{cite news|last1=Chan|first1=Casey|title=Sony Ericsson XPERIA X10 Officially Announced|url=http://www.androidcentral.com/sony-ericsson-xperia-x10-officially-announced|access-date=21 October 2015|publisher=Androidcentral|date=3 November 2009}} It was the first in the Xperia line to feature the [[Android (operating system)|Android]] operating system, where previous models ran on the [[Windows Mobile]] OS. The phone was praised on its design, but its downfall was its use of [[Android Donut|Android 1.6]] at a time when competitors were on 2.1. There was a great delay in the update of the firmware, due to the heavily skinned OS, as well as Timescape and Mediascape which needed to be reprogrammed every time an update was made. The phone also lacked pinch to zoom, but this was added later as well as HD video recording. The [[X10 Mini]] and the [[X10 Mini Pro]] were, as the names suggest, smaller versions of the X10. These were received relatively well and proved to be very popular, as there were no other smartphones on the market at that time which were as small as the two. The Z series smartphones continued the Xperia legacy with an omni-balance design and water resistance. On several Sony Xperia smartphones such as the [[Xperia Z]], the [[charging port]] is located at the top of the left edge, rather than popularly at the bottom center.{{cite web |url=https://de.ifixit.com/Anleitung/Sony+Xperia+Z+Charging+Port+-+Micro+USB+Replacement/102432 |website=iFixit |title=Sony Xperia Z Charging Port / Micro USB Replacement |first1=Alex |last1=Sander |date=19 January 2018 }} The Xperia Z is the earliest known device to feature [[high dynamic range]] filming, and does it at 1080p. Its image sensor is an [[Exmor]] IMX135.{{cite web |last1=P. |first1=Daniel |title=Sony Xperia Z HDR video compilation: less burn, more detail |url=https://www.phonearena.com/news/Sony-Xperia-Z-HDR-video-compilation-less-burn-more-detail_id38773 |website=Phone Arena |access-date=2 December 2021 |date=2013-01-21}} After the [[Sony Xperia Z]] (early 2013), the [[Sony Xperia Z1|Z1]] (late 2013) was released with increased processing performance and a physical shutter button, as well as [[augmented reality]] camera effects such as a walking dinosaur.{{cite web |title=Golem.de: IT-News für Profis |url=https://www.dpreview.com/reviews/sony-xperia-z1-camera-review/5 |website=www.golem.de}} In early 2014, the [[Sony Xperia Z2]] was introduced with [[2160p]] video recording, [[1080p]] at 60 frames per second, and [[720p]] at 120fps for [[slow motion]], as well as precluded [[screencast]]ing functionality.{{cite web |title=How to record screen on Sony Xperia Z2 |url=https://www.devicesfaq.com/en/record-screen/sony-xperia-z2 |website=www.devicesfaq.com}} In 2016, Sony introduced the new Xperia X series to replace the Z series and in 2018, Sony introduced the [[Sony Xperia XZ2]] along with the [[Sony Xperia XZ2 Compact]] at Mobile World Congress 2018 featuring Sony's brand new "Ambient Flow" smartphone design while the premium smartphone, the [[Sony Xperia XZ2 Premium]] featuring a [[4K resolution|4K]] [[High Dynamic Range|HDR]] Display and a 19 [[Megapixel|MP]] + 12 [[Megapixel|MP]] MotionEye Dual camera built for 'extreme' low-light shooting was announced two months later.{{Cite web | url=https://www.theverge.com/circuitbreaker/2018/4/16/17240508/sony-xz2-premium-announced-specs-features-release-date |title = Sony's Xperia XZ2 Premium has a 4K display and cameras built for 'extreme' low-light shooting|date = 16 April 2018}} Sony has been criticized for the heavily inconsistent naming of their Xperia devices.{{Cite web|date=24 February 2020|title=Xperia 1 II is a silly name that perfectly sums up Sony's smartphone woes|url=https://www.androidauthority.com/xperia-1-ii-mark-2-name-1086350/|access-date=15 July 2020|website=Android Authority|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|last=Osati|first=Sohrab|date=27 February 2019|title=Sony Mobile still can't figure out how to name phones|url=https://sonyreconsidered.com/sony-mobile-still-cant-figure-out-how-to-name-phones-1c981c5b62f9|access-date=15 July 2020|website=Medium|language=en}}{{Cite web|last=Pocket-lint|date=24 February 2020|title=Sony Xperia has a new naming strategy: Here's how it works|url=https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/sony-mobile/151150-sony-xperia-new-naming-strategy|access-date=15 July 2020|website=Pocket-lint|language=en-gb}} ==Sony Ericsson== ===Smartphones
